name.markdownDescription:
string: The name to use for the MQTT Component.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

retain.markdownDescription:
boolean: If all MQTT state messages should be retained. Defaults to `True`.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

discovery.markdownDescription:
boolean: Manually enable/disable discovery for a component. Defaults to the global default.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

state_topic.markdownDescription:
string: The topic to publish state updates to. Defaults to `<TOPIC_PREFIX>/<COMPONENT_TYPE>/<COMPONENT_NAME>/state`.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

availability.markdownDescription:
Manually set what should be sent to Home Assistant for showing entity availability. Default derived from [global birth/last will message](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-last-will-birth).



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

command_topic.markdownDescription:
string: The topic to subscribe to for commands from the remote. Defaults to `<TOPIC_PREFIX>/<COMPONENT_TYPE>/<COMPONENT_NAME>/command`.



*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

CONFIG.MQTT_COMMAND_COMPONENT_SCHEMA.markdownDescription:
All components in ESPHome that do some sort of communication through MQTT can have some overrides for specific options.

*See also: [MQTT Component Base Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-component-base-configuration)*

mode.markdownDescription:
string: A pin mode to set for the pin at startup, corresponds to Arduino’s `pinMode` call.



*See also: [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#pin-schema)*

inverted.markdownDescription:
boolean: If all read and written values should be treated as inverted. Defaults to `False`.



*See also: [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#pin-schema)*

PIN.GPIO_FULL_INPUT_PIN_SCHEMA.markdownDescription:
In some places, ESPHome also supports a more advanced “pin schema”.

*See also: [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#pin-schema)*

transmitter_id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The remote transmitter to send the remote code with. Defaults to the first one defined in the configuration.



*See also: [Remote Transmitter Actions](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-actions)*

repeat.markdownDescription:
Optionally set the code to be repeated a number of times. Defaults to sending the code only once.
  * **times** (int): The number of times to repeat the code.
  
  * **wait_time** ([Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): The time to wait between repeats.
  
  



*See also: [Remote Transmitter Actions](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-actions)*

REMOTE_BASE.BASE_REMOTE_TRANSMITTER_SCHE.markdownDescription:
Remote transmitters support a number of [actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) that can be used to send remote codes. All supported protocols are listed below. All actions additionally have these configuration variables:

*See also: [Remote Transmitter Actions](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-actions)*

canbus_id.markdownDescription:
Optionally set the can bus id to use for transmitting the frame. Not needed if you are using only 1 can bus.



*See also: [canbus.send Action](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

can_id.markdownDescription:
int: Allows to override the can id configured in the can bus device.



*See also: [canbus.send Action](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

use_extended_id.markdownDescription:
boolean: default *False* identifies the type of *can_id*: *False*: Standard 11 Bit IDs, *True*: Extended 29Bit ID



*See also: [canbus.send Action](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

data.markdownDescription:
binary data: Data to transmit, up to 8 bytes or characters are supported by can bus per frame.



*See also: [canbus.send Action](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the TM1651.



*See also: [tm1651.set_level_percent Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-level-percent-action)*

[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the TM1651.



*See also: [tm1651.set_level Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-level-action)*

[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the TM1651.



*See also: [tm1651.set_brightness Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-brightness-action)*

brightness.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), int: There is three levels of brightness (`1`, `2` or `3`) from lowest to highest brightness.



*See also: [tm1651.set_brightness Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-brightness-action)*

delay.markdownDescription:
This action delays the execution of the next action in the action list by a specified time period.

*See also: [delay Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#delay-action)*

condition.markdownDescription:
[All Conditions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition): The condition to check which branch to take. See [Conditions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition).



*See also: [if Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

then.markdownDescription:
[Actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): The action to perform if the condition evaluates to true. Defaults to doing nothing.



*See also: [if Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

else.markdownDescription:
[Actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): The action to perform if the condition evaluates to false. Defaults to doing nothing.



*See also: [if Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

if.markdownDescription:
This action first evaluated a certain condition (`if:`) and then either executes the `then:` branch or the `else:` branch depending on the output of the condition.

*See also: [if Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action)*

condition.markdownDescription:
The condition to check whether to execute. See [Conditions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition).



*See also: [while Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action)*

then.markdownDescription:
[Actions](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): The action to perform until the condition evaluates to false.



*See also: [while Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action)*

while.markdownDescription:
This action is similar to the [if](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#if-action) Action. The `while` action executes a block until a given condition evaluates to false.

*See also: [while Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action)*

wait_until.markdownDescription:
This action allows your automations to wait until a condition evaluates to true. (So this is just a shorthand way of writing a `while` action with an empty `then` block.)

*See also: [wait_until Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#wait-until-action)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
This action executes an arbitrary piece of C++ code (see [Lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)).

*See also: [lambda Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#lambda-action)*

component.update.markdownDescription:
Using this action you can manually call the `update()` method of a component.

*See also: [component.update Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#component-update-action)*

logger.log.markdownDescription:
Print a formatted message to the logs.

*See also: [logger.log Action](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-action)*

mqtt.publish.markdownDescription:
Publish an MQTT message on a topic using this action in automations.

*See also: [mqtt.publish Action](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-action)*

mqtt.publish_json.markdownDescription:
Publish a JSON-formatted MQTT message on a topic using this action in automations.

*See also: [mqtt.publish_json Action](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-json-action)*

data.markdownDescription:
int: The JVC code to send, see dumper output for more info.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_jvc Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-jvc-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_jvc.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a JVC infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_jvc Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-jvc-action)*

data.markdownDescription:
int: The LG code to send, see dumper output for more info.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_lg Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-lg-action)*

nbits.markdownDescription:
int: The number of bits to send. Defaults to `28`.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_lg Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-lg-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_lg.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends an LG infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_lg Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-lg-action)*

address.markdownDescription:
int: The address to send, see dumper output for more details.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_nec Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-nec-action)*

command.markdownDescription:
int: The NEC command to send.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_nec Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-nec-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_nec.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends an NEC infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_nec Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-nec-action)*

rc_code_1.markdownDescription:
int: The remote control code to send, see dumper output for more details.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_pioneer Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-pioneer-action)*

rc_code_2.markdownDescription:
int: The secondary remote control code to send; some codes are sent in two parts.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_pioneer Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-pioneer-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_pioneer.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a Pioneer infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_pioneer Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-pioneer-action)*

data.markdownDescription:
int: The Sony code to send, see dumper output for more info.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_sony Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-sony-action)*

nbits.markdownDescription:
int: The number of bits to send. Defaults to `12`.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_sony Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-sony-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_sony.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) a Sony infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_sony Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-sony-action)*

code.markdownDescription:
list: The raw code to send as a list of integers. Positive numbers represent a digital high signal and negative numbers a digital low signal. The number itself encodes how long the signal should last (in microseconds).



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw-action)*

carrier_frequency.markdownDescription:
float: Optionally set a frequency to send the signal with for infrared signals. Defaults to `0Hz`.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_raw.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a raw code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw-action)*

address.markdownDescription:
int: The address to send, see dumper output for more details.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc5 Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc5-action)*

command.markdownDescription:
int: The RC5 command to send.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc5 Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc5-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_rc5.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends an RC5 infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc5 Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc5-action)*

code.markdownDescription:
string: The raw code to send, copy this from the dump output.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-raw-action)*

protocol.markdownDescription:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more information.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-raw-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_ra.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a raw RC-Switch code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-raw-action)*

group.markdownDescription:
string: The group to send the command to.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_a Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-a-action)*

device.markdownDescription:
string: The device in the group to send the command to.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_a Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-a-action)*

state.markdownDescription:
boolean: The on/off state to send.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_a Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-a-action)*

protocol.markdownDescription:

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_a Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-a-action)*

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_a Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-a-action)*

address.markdownDescription:
int: The address to send the command to.

channel.markdownDescription:
int: The channel to send the command to.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_b Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-b-action)*

state.markdownDescription:
boolean: The on/off state to send.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_b Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-b-action)*

protocol.markdownDescription:
The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more information.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_b Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-b-action)*

family.markdownDescription:
string: The family to send the command to. Range is `a` to `p`.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_c Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-c-action)*

group.markdownDescription:
int: The group to send the command to. Range is 1 to 4.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_c Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-c-action)*

device.markdownDescription:
int: The device to send the command to. Range is 1 to 4.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_c Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-c-action)*

boolean: The on/off state to send.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_c Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-c-action)*

group.markdownDescription:
int: The group to send the command to. Range is 1 to 4.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_d Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-d-action)*

device.markdownDescription:
int: The device to send the command to. Range is 1 to 3.

boolean: The on/off state to send.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_rc_switch_type_d Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-rc-switch-type-d-action)*

data.markdownDescription:
int: The data to send, see dumper output for more details.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_samsung Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-samsung-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_samsung.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a Samsung infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_samsung Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-samsung-action)*

address.markdownDescription:
int: The address to send the command to, see dumper output for more details.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_panasonic Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-panasonic-action)*

command.markdownDescription:
int: The command to send.



*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_panasonic Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-panasonic-action)*

remote_transmitter.transmit_panasonic.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a Panasonic infrared remote code to a remote transmitter.

*See also: [remote_transmitter.transmit_panasonic Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-panasonic-action)*

uart.write.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a defined UART signal to the given UART bus.

*See also: [uart.write Action](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#uart-write-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the light.



*See also: [light.toggle Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-toggle-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The length of the transition if the light supports it.



*See also: [light.toggle Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-toggle-action)*

light.toggle.markdownDescription:
This action toggles a light with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [light.toggle Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-toggle-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the light.



*See also: [light.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-control-action)*

state.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), boolean: Change the ON/OFF state of the light.



*See also: [light.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-control-action)*

light.control.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) is a generic call to change the state of a light - it is essentially just a combination of the turn_on and turn_off calls.

*See also: [light.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-control-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the light.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The length of the transition if the light supports it.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

flash_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): If set, will flash the given color for this period of time and then go back to the previous state.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

effect.markdownDescription:
string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): If set, will attempt to start an effect with the given name.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

brightness.markdownDescription:
percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The brightness of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing brightness.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

red.markdownDescription:
percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The red channel of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing red.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

green.markdownDescription:
percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The green channel of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing green channel.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

blue.markdownDescription:
percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The blue channel of the light. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing blue channel.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

white.markdownDescription:
percentage, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The white channel value of RGBW lights. Must be in range `0%` to `100%` or `0.0` to `1.0`. Defaults to not changing white value.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

color_temperature.markdownDescription:
float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The white color temperature value (in [mireds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mired) or Kelvin) for CWWW / RGBWW lights. Defaults to not changing the color temperature value.



*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

light.turn_on.markdownDescription:
This action turns a light with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [light.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-on-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the light.



*See also: [light.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-off-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The length of the transition if the light supports it.



*See also: [light.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-off-action)*

light.turn_off.markdownDescription:
This action turns a light with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [light.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-turn-off-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the light.



*See also: [light.dim_relative Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

relative_brightness.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), percentage: The relative brightness to dim the light by.



*See also: [light.dim_relative Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time), [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The length of the transition.



*See also: [light.dim_relative Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

light.dim_relative.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to dim a light that supports brightness by a relative amount.

*See also: [light.dim_relative Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-dim-relative-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the addressable light to control.



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

range_from.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), int: The beginning of the range of LEDs to control. 0-based indexing. Defaults to 0 (the beginning of the strip).



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

range_to.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), int: The end of the range of LEDs to control - this is a half-open interval. 0-based indexing. Defaults to the end of the strip (`num_leds`).



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

red.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), percentage: The value to set the red channel to.



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

green.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), percentage: The value to set the green channel to.



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

blue.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), percentage: The value to set the blue channel to.



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

white.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), percentage: The value to set the white channel to.



*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

light.addressable_set.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually set a range of LEDs on an addressable light to a specific color.

*See also: [light.addressable_set Action](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-addressable-set-action)*

homeassistant.service.markdownDescription:
When using the native API with Home Assistant, you can create Home Assistant service calls straight from ESPHome [Automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation).

*See also: [homeassistant.service Action](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#homeassistant-service-action)*

homeassistant.event.markdownDescription:
When using the native API with Home Assistant, you can create events in the Home Assistant event bus straight from ESPHome [Automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation).

*See also: [homeassistant.event Action](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#homeassistant-event-action)*

homeassistant.tag_scanned.markdownDescription:
When using the native API with Home Assistant, you can push tag_scanned to Home Assistant straight from ESPHome [Automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation).

*See also: [homeassistant.tag_scanned Action](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#homeassistant-tag-scanned-action)*

canbus.send.markdownDescription:
The can bus can transmit frames by means of the `canbus.send` action. There are several forms to use it:

*See also: [canbus.send Action](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-send-action)*

climate.control.markdownDescription:
This is an [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) for setting parameters for climate devices.

*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

cover.open.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) opens the cover with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [cover.open Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-open-action)*

cover.close.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) closes the cover with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [cover.close Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-close-action)*

cover.stop.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) stops the cover with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [cover.stop Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-stop-action)*

cover.control.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) is a more generic version of the other cover actions and allows all cover attributes to be set.

*See also: [cover.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

deep_sleep.enter.markdownDescription:
This action makes the given deep sleep component enter deep sleep immediately.

*See also: [deep_sleep.enter Action](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-enter-action)*

deep_sleep.prevent.markdownDescription:
This action prevents the given deep sleep component from entering deep sleep. Useful for

*See also: [deep_sleep.prevent Action](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-prevent-action)*

dfplayer.play_next.markdownDescription:
Starts playback of next track or skips to the next track.

*See also: [dfplayer.play_next Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-play-next-action)*

dfplayer.play_previous.markdownDescription:
Plays the previously played track.

*See also: [dfplayer.play_previous Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-play-previous-action)*

dfplayer.play_folder.markdownDescription:
Plays files inside numbered folders, folders must be numbered from 1 and with leading zeros. Like `01`, `02`, … etc. Files inside the folders must be numbered with two leading zeros, like `001.mp3`, `002.mp3`, … etc. Folder numbers can range from 1 to 99 and file name from 1 to 255 or folder number from 1 to 10 and file number from 1 to 1000.

*See also: [dfplayer.play_folder Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-play-folder-action)*

dfplayer.set_device.markdownDescription:
Changes the device in use. Valid values are `TF_CARD` and `USB`.

*See also: [dfplayer.set_device Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-set-device-action)*

dfplayer.sleep.markdownDescription:
Enters sleep mode. Playback is stopped and the action `dfplayer.set_device: TF_CARD` should be send for playback to be enabled again.

*See also: [dfplayer.sleep Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-sleep-action)*

dfplayer.start.markdownDescription:
Starts playing a track or resumes paused playback.

*See also: [dfplayer.start Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-start-action)*

dfplayer.pause.markdownDescription:
Pauses playback, playback can be resumed from the same position with `dfplayer.start`.

*See also: [dfplayer.pause Action](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-pause-action)*

fan.toggle.markdownDescription:
Toggles the ON/OFF state of the fan with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [fan.toggle Action](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-toggle-action)*

fan.turn_off.markdownDescription:
Turns the fan with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [fan.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-turn-off-action)*

fan.turn_on.markdownDescription:
Turns the fan with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [fan.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#fan-turn-on-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id) of the global variable to set.



*See also: [globals.set Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#globals-set-action)*

value.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The value to set the global variable to.



*See also: [globals.set Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#globals-set-action)*

globals.set.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to change the value of a [global](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-globals) variable without having to go through the lambda syntax.

*See also: [globals.set Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#globals-set-action)*

method.markdownDescription:
string: HTTP method to use (`GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `PATCH`).



*See also: [http_request.send Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-send-action)*

body.markdownDescription:
string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): A HTTP body string to send with request.



*See also: [http_request.post Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

json.markdownDescription:
mapping: A HTTP body in JSON format. Values are [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable). See [Examples](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-examples).



*See also: [http_request.post Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

http_request.post.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a POST request.

*See also: [http_request.post Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

url.markdownDescription:
string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): URL to send request.



*See also: [http_request.get Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

headers.markdownDescription:
mapping: Map of HTTP headers. Values are [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable).



*See also: [http_request.get Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

verify_ssl.markdownDescription:
boolean: Verify the SSL certificate of the endpoint. Defaults to `true`.



*See also: [http_request.get Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

http_request.get.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) sends a GET request.

*See also: [http_request.get Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

output.turn_on.markdownDescription:
This action turns the output with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [output.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-turn-on-action)*

output.turn_off.markdownDescription:
This action turns the output with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [output.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-turn-off-action)*

output.set_level.markdownDescription:
This action sets the float output to the given level when executed. Note: This only works with floating point outputs like ESP8266 PWM or LEDC.

*See also: [output.set_level Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-set-level-action)*

rf_bridge.send_code.markdownDescription:
Send an RF code using this action in automations.

*See also: [rf_bridge.send_code Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-code-action)*

rf_bridge.learn.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to learn new protocol timings using this action in automations. A new code with timings will be returned to [on_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-on-code-received)

*See also: [rf_bridge.learn Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-learn-action)*

rf_bridge.start_advanced_sniffing.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to listen for the advanced/extra protocols defined in the portisch firmware. The decoded codes with length and protocol will be returned to [on_advanced_code_received Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-on-advanced-code-received)

*See also: [rf_bridge.start_advanced_sniffing Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-start-advanced-sniffing-action)*

rf_bridge.stop_advanced_sniffing.markdownDescription:
Tell the RF Bridge to stop listening for the advanced/extra protocols defined in the portisch firmware.

*See also: [rf_bridge.stop_advanced_sniffing Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-stop-advanced-sniffing-action)*

rf_bridge.send_advanced_code.markdownDescription:
Send an  RF code using this action in automations.

*See also: [rf_bridge.send_advanced_code Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-advanced-code-action)*

rf_bridge.send_raw.markdownDescription:
Send a raw RF code using this action in automations.

*See also: [rf_bridge.send_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/rf_bridge.html#rf-bridge-send-raw-action)*

script.execute.markdownDescription:
This action executes the script. The script **mode** dictates what will happen if the script was already running.

*See also: [script.execute Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-execute-action)*

script.stop.markdownDescription:
This action allows you to stop a given script during execution. If the script is not running, it does nothing. This is useful right now if your want to stop a script that contains a `delay` action, `wait_until` action, or is inside a `while` loop, etc. You can also call this action from the script itself, and any subsequent action will not be executed.

*See also: [script.stop Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-stop-action)*

script.wait.markdownDescription:
This action suspends execution of the automation until a script has finished executing.

*See also: [script.wait Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-wait-action)*

servo.write.markdownDescription:
To use your servo motor in [automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation) or templates, you can use this action to set the target level of the servo from -100% to 100%.

*See also: [servo.write Action](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-write-action)*

servo.detach.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to disable the output on a servo motor - this will make the servo motor stop immediately and disable its active control.

*See also: [servo.detach Action](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#servo-detach-action)*

sim800l.send_sms.markdownDescription:
Send a SMS message to a phone recipient using this action in automations.

*See also: [sim800l.send_sms Action](https://esphome.io/components/sim800l.html#sim800l-send-sms-action)*

stepper.set_target.markdownDescription:
To use your stepper motor in [automations](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation) or templates, you can use this action to set the target position (in steps). The stepper will always run towards the target position and stop once it has reached the target.

*See also: [stepper.set_target Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-target-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the stepper.



*See also: [stepper.report_position Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-report-position-action)*

position.markdownDescription:
int, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): The position to report in steps.



*See also: [stepper.report_position Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-report-position-action)*

stepper.report_position.markdownDescription:
All steppers start out with a target and current position of `0` on boot. However, if you for example want to home a stepper motor, it can be useful to **report** the stepper where it is currently at.

*See also: [stepper.report_position Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-report-position-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the stepper.



*See also: [stepper.set_speed Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-speed-action)*

speed.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), float: The speed in `steps/s` (steps per seconds) to drive the stepper at.



*See also: [stepper.set_speed Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-speed-action)*

stepper.set_speed.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to set the speed of a stepper at runtime.

*See also: [stepper.set_speed Action](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#stepper-set-speed-action)*

switch.turn_on.markdownDescription:
This action turns a switch with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [switch.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-turn-on-action)*

switch.turn_off.markdownDescription:
This action turns a switch with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [switch.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-turn-off-action)*

switch.toggle.markdownDescription:
This action toggles a switch with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [switch.toggle Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-toggle-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the TM1651.



*See also: [tm1651.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-turn-on-action)*

tm1651.turn_on.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) turns on the LEDs.

*See also: [tm1651.turn_on Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-turn-on-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the TM1651.



*See also: [tm1651.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-turn-off-action)*

tm1651.turn_off.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) turns off all the LEDs.

*See also: [tm1651.turn_off Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-turn-off-action)*

tm1651.set_level_percent.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) changes the level of the battery display at runtime. Automatically calculates input level in percentages to actual level for the display.

*See also: [tm1651.set_level_percent Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-level-percent-action)*

tm1651.set_level.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) changes the level of the battery display at runtime.

*See also: [tm1651.set_level Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-level-action)*

tm1651.set_brightness.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually change the brightness of the battery display at runtime.

*See also: [tm1651.set_brightness Action](https://esphome.io/components/tm1651.html#tm1651-set-brightness-action)*

binary_sensor.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template binary sensor from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `binary_sensor.template.publish` action.

*See also: [binary_sensor.template.publish Action](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/template.html#binary-sensor-template-publish-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): ID of the PID Climate being reset.



*See also: [climate.pid.reset_integral_term Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-reset-integral-term-action)*

climate.pid.reset_integral_term.markdownDescription:
This action resets the integral term of the PID controller to 0. This might be necessary under certain conditions to avoid the control loop to overshoot (or undershoot) a target.

*See also: [climate.pid.reset_integral_term Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-reset-integral-term-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): ID of the PID Climate to start autotuning for.



*See also: [climate.pid.autotune Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

noiseband.markdownDescription:
float: The noiseband of the process (=sensor) variable. The value of the PID controller must be able to reach this value. Defaults to `0.25`.



*See also: [climate.pid.autotune Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

positive_output.markdownDescription:
float: The positive output power to drive the heat output at. Defaults to `1.0`.



*See also: [climate.pid.autotune Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

negative_output.markdownDescription:
float: The positive output power to drive the cool output at. Defaults to `-1.0`.



*See also: [climate.pid.autotune Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

climate.pid.autotune.markdownDescription:
This action starts the autotune process of the PID controller.

*See also: [climate.pid.autotune Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-autotune-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): ID of the PID Climate to start autotuning for.



*See also: [climate.pid.set_control_parameters Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

kp.markdownDescription:
float: The factor for the proportional term of the PID controller.



*See also: [climate.pid.set_control_parameters Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

ki.markdownDescription:
float: The factor for the integral term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [climate.pid.set_control_parameters Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

kd.markdownDescription:
float: The factor for the derivative term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [climate.pid.set_control_parameters Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

climate.pid.set_control_parameters.markdownDescription:
This action sets new values for the control parameters of the PID controller. This can be used to manually tune the PID controller. Make sure to take update the values you want on the YAML file! They will reset on the next reboot.

*See also: [climate.pid.set_control_parameters Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#climate-pid-set-control-parameters-action)*

cover.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template cover from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `cover.template.publish` action.

*See also: [cover.template.publish Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/template.html#cover-template-publish-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the PWM output to change.



*See also: [output.esp8266_pwm.set_frequency Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#output-esp8266-pwm-set-frequency-action)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), float: The frequency to set in hertz.



*See also: [output.esp8266_pwm.set_frequency Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#output-esp8266-pwm-set-frequency-action)*

output.esp8266_pwm.set_frequency.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually change the frequency of an ESP8266 PWM channel at runtime. Use cases include controlling a passive buzzer (for pitch control).

*See also: [output.esp8266_pwm.set_frequency Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#output-esp8266-pwm-set-frequency-action)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the LEDC output to change.



*See also: [output.ledc.set_frequency Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#output-ledc-set-frequency-action)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), float: The frequency to set in hertz.



*See also: [output.ledc.set_frequency Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#output-ledc-set-frequency-action)*

output.ledc.set_frequency.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to manually change the frequency of an LEDC channel at runtime. Use cases include controlling a passive buzzer (for pitch control).

*See also: [output.ledc.set_frequency Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#output-ledc-set-frequency-action)*

sensor.integration.reset.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) allows you to reset the value of the integration sensor to zero. For example this can be used to reset the integration sensor to zero at midnight with a time-based automation.

*See also: [sensor.integration.reset Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/integration.html#sensor-integration-reset-action)*

mhz19.abc_disable.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) disables automatic baseline calibration on the sensor with the given ID.

*See also: [mhz19.abc_disable Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/mhz19.html#mhz19-abc-disable-action)*

mhz19.abc_enable.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) enables automatic baseline calibration on the sensor with the given ID.

*See also: [mhz19.abc_enable Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/mhz19.html#mhz19-abc-enable-action)*

mhz19.calibrate_zero.markdownDescription:
This [action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) executes zero point calibration command on the sensor with the given ID.

*See also: [mhz19.calibrate_zero Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/mhz19.html#mhz19-calibrate-zero-action)*

sensor.rotary_encoder.set_value.markdownDescription:
The internal state of the rotary encoder can be manually changed to any value with this action. After executing this action, rotating the encoder further will increase/decrease the state relative to the newly set internal value.

*See also: [sensor.rotary_encoder.set_value Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/rotary_encoder.html#sensor-rotary-encoder-set-value-action)*

sensor.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template sensor from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `sensor.template.publish` action.

*See also: [sensor.template.publish Action](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/template.html#sensor-template-publish-action)*

switch.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template switch from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `switch.template.publish` action.

*See also: [switch.template.publish Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/template.html#switch-template-publish-action)*

text_sensor.template.publish.markdownDescription:
You can also publish a state to a template text sensor from elsewhere in your YAML file with the `text_sensor.template.publish` action.

*See also: [text_sensor.template.publish Action](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/template.html#text-sensor-template-publish-action)*

ds1307.write_time.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) triggers a synchronization of the current system time to the RTC hardware.

*See also: [ds1307.write_time Action](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#ds1307-write-time-action)*

ds1307.read_time.markdownDescription:
This [Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action) triggers a synchronization of the current system time from the RTC hardware.

*See also: [ds1307.read_time Action](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#ds1307-read-time-action)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
This condition performs an arbitrary piece of C++ code (see [Lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda)) and can be used to create conditional flow in actions.

*See also: [lambda Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#lambda-condition)*

time.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The time for which the condition has to have been true.



*See also: [for Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#for-condition)*

for.markdownDescription:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) allows you to check if a given condition has been true for at least a given amount of time.

*See also: [for Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#for-condition)*

mqtt.connected.markdownDescription:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if the MQTT client is currently connected to the MQTT broker.

*See also: [mqtt.connected Condition](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-connected-condition)*

api.connected.markdownDescription:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if at least one client is connected to the ESPHome native API. Please note client not only includes Home Assistant, but also ESPHome’s OTA log output if logs are shown remotely.

*See also: [api.connected Condition](https://esphome.io/components/api.html#api-connected-condition)*

above.markdownDescription:
float: The minimum for the condition.



*See also: [sensor.in_range Condition](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-in-range-condition)*

below.markdownDescription:
float: The maximum for the condition.



*See also: [sensor.in_range Condition](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-in-range-condition)*

sensor.in_range.markdownDescription:
This condition passes if the state of the given sensor is inside a range.

*See also: [sensor.in_range Condition](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-in-range-condition)*

dfplayer.is_playing.markdownDescription:
This Condition returns true while playback is active.

*See also: [dfplayer.is_playing Condition](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#dfplayer-is-playing-condition)*

rtttl.is_playing.markdownDescription:
This Condition returns true while playback is active.

*See also: [rtttl.is_playing Condition](https://esphome.io/components/rtttl.html#rtttl-is-playing-condition)*

script.is_running.markdownDescription:
This [condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) allows you to check if a given script is running. In case scripts are run in `parallel`, this condition only tells you if at least one script of the given id is running, not how many.

*See also: [script.is_running Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-is-running-condition)*

time.has_time.markdownDescription:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if time has been set and is valid.

*See also: [time.has_time Condition](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#time-has-time-condition)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The text sensor ID.



*See also: [text_sensor.state Condition](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/index.html#text-sensor-state-condition)*

state.markdownDescription:
[templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable), string: The state to compare to.



*See also: [text_sensor.state Condition](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/index.html#text-sensor-state-condition)*

text_sensor.state.markdownDescription:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) allows you to check if a given text sensor has a specific state.

*See also: [text_sensor.state Condition](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/index.html#text-sensor-state-condition)*

wifi.connected.markdownDescription:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if the WiFi client is currently connected to a station.

*See also: [wifi.connected Condition](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-connected-condition)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda): The code to execute. `static` variables are especially useful.



*See also: [Lambda Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#lambda-effect)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which the lambda code is executed. A value of `0ms` means that the lambda is always executed, without a cool-down. Defaults to `0ms`.



*See also: [Lambda Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#lambda-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the custom effect.



*See also: [Lambda Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#lambda-effect)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
This effect allows you to write completely custom light effects yourself using [lambdas](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda).

*See also: [Lambda Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#lambda-effect)*

sequence.markdownDescription:
[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): The actions to perform in sequence until the effect is stopped.



*See also: [Automation Light Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#automation-light-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect.



*See also: [Automation Light Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#automation-light-effect)*

automation.markdownDescription:
Additionally to the `lambda` and `addressable_lambda` light effects, effects can also be written through ESPHome’s [Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation) system with the `automation` effect type.

*See also: [Automation Light Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#automation-light-effect)*

transition_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The duration of each transition to start. Defaults to `5s`.



*See also: [Random Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#random-effect)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which a new color is selected and transitioned to.



*See also: [Random Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#random-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Random`.



*See also: [Random Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#random-effect)*

random.markdownDescription:
This effect makes a transition (of length `transition_length`) to a randomly-chosen color every `update_interval`.

*See also: [Random Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#random-effect)*

colors.markdownDescription:
list: A list of colors to cycle through. Defaults to a quick cycle between ON and OFF.
  * **state** (*Optional*, boolean): The ON/OFF state to show. Defaults to `True`.
  
  * **brightness** (*Optional*, percentage): The brightness of the light. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **red** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage that the red color should be on for RGB lights. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **green** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage that the green color should be on for RGB lights. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **blue** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage that the blue color should be on for RGB lights. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **white** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage that the white color should be on for RGBW lights. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **duration** (**Required**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): The duration this color should be active.
  
  



*See also: [Strobe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#strobe-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Strobe`.



*See also: [Strobe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#strobe-effect)*

strobe.markdownDescription:
This effect cycles through a list of colors with specific durations.

*See also: [Strobe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#strobe-effect)*

alpha.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage that the last color value should affect the light. More or less the “forget-factor” of an exponential moving average. Defaults to `95%`.



*See also: [Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#flicker-effect)*

intensity.markdownDescription:
percentage: The intensity of the flickering, basically the maximum amplitude of the random offsets. Defaults to `1.5%`.



*See also: [Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#flicker-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Flicker`.



*See also: [Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#flicker-effect)*

flicker.markdownDescription:
This effect “hovers” around the active color of the light and flickers each color channel a bit.

*See also: [Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#flicker-effect)*

addressable_lambda.markdownDescription:
This effect allows you to access each LED individually in a custom light effect.

*See also: [Addressable Lambda Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-lambda-effect)*

speed.markdownDescription:
int: The speed of the effect, unitless. Defaults to `10`.



*See also: [Addressable Rainbow Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-rainbow-effect)*

width.markdownDescription:
int: The “width” of a full-scale rainbow, unitless. Defaults to `50`.



*See also: [Addressable Rainbow Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-rainbow-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Rainbow`.



*See also: [Addressable Rainbow Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-rainbow-effect)*

addressable_rainbow.markdownDescription:
A light effect for individually-addressable LEDs that creates a moving rainbow over the whole LED strip using the HSV color wheel.

*See also: [Addressable Rainbow Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-rainbow-effect)*

colors.markdownDescription:
list: The colors to shift in at the beginning of the strip. Defaults to shifting in random colors.
  * **red** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage the red color channel should be on. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **green** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage the green color channel should be on. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **blue** (*Optional*, percentage): The percentage the blue color channel should be on. Defaults to `100%`.
  
  * **random** (*Optional*, boolean): If set to `True`, will overwrite the RGB colors by a new, randomly-chosen color each time. Defaults to `False`.
  
  * **num_leds** (*Optional*, int): The number of leds of this type to have before moving on to the next color.
  
  



*See also: [Addressable Color Wipe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-color-wipe-effect)*

add_led_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which to shift in new leds at the beginning of the strip. Defaults to `100ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Color Wipe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-color-wipe-effect)*

reverse.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to reverse the direction of the color wipe. Defaults to `False`.



*See also: [Addressable Color Wipe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-color-wipe-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Color Wipe`.



*See also: [Addressable Color Wipe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-color-wipe-effect)*

addressable_color_wipe.markdownDescription:
A light effect for individually-addressable LEDs that continuously introduces new colors at the beginning of the strip and shifts them forward every `add_led_interval`.

*See also: [Addressable Color Wipe Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-color-wipe-effect)*

move_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which to move the dot/line one LED forward. Defaults to `100ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Scan Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-scan-effect)*

scan_width.markdownDescription:
integer: The number of LEDs to use. Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [Addressable Scan Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-scan-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Scan`.



*See also: [Addressable Scan Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-scan-effect)*

addressable_scan.markdownDescription:
Create a single, fast-moving dot moving back and forth an individually-addressable LED strip. The color is chosen by the currently active light color.

*See also: [Addressable Scan Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-scan-effect)*

twinkle_probability.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage with which, at any time step, a randomly-chosen LED should start its twinkle animation.



*See also: [Addressable Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-twinkle-effect)*

progress_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which to progress the effect. This affects the duration of a twinkle animation. Defaults to `4ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-twinkle-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Twinkle`.



*See also: [Addressable Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-twinkle-effect)*

addressable_twinkle.markdownDescription:
A light effect for individually-addressable LED strips that randomly chooses some LEDs and let’s them bright up for a moment, like a stars twinkling in the night’s sky. The color of the pixels will be chosen by the currently active light color.

*See also: [Addressable Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-twinkle-effect)*

twinkle_probability.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage with which, at any time step, a randomly-chosen LED should start its twinkle animation.



*See also: [Addressable Random Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-random-twinkle-effect)*

progress_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which to progress the effect. This affects the duration of a twinkle animation. Defaults to `4ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Random Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-random-twinkle-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Random Twinkle`.



*See also: [Addressable Random Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-random-twinkle-effect)*

addressable_random_twinkle.markdownDescription:
A light effect similar to `addressable_twinkle`, but using random colors for each twinkle animation.

*See also: [Addressable Random Twinkle Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-random-twinkle-effect)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval with which to progress the effect. Defaults to `32ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Fireworks Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-fireworks-effect)*

spark_probability.markdownDescription:
percentage: The probability to start a new firework spark at a randomly-chosen LED at any given time step. Defaults to `10%`.



*See also: [Addressable Fireworks Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-fireworks-effect)*

use_random_color.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to use random colors for new firework sparks. Defaults to using the currently active light color.



*See also: [Addressable Fireworks Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-fireworks-effect)*

fade_out_rate.markdownDescription:
integer: The rate with which to fade out the LED strip, unitless. Needs to be carefully chosen so that the whole strip doesn’t light up forever if the fade out rate is too low or that the firework sparks do not propagate for a long time. Defaults to `120`.



*See also: [Addressable Fireworks Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-fireworks-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Fireworks`.



*See also: [Addressable Fireworks Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-fireworks-effect)*

addressable_fireworks.markdownDescription:
A light effect for individually-addressable LED strips that randomly sparks some fireworks at random positions and lets the sparkles cascade over the LED strip.

*See also: [Addressable Fireworks Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-fireworks-effect)*

update_interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The time interval for updating the random offsets. Defaults to `16ms`.



*See also: [Addressable Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-flicker-effect)*

intensity.markdownDescription:
percentage: The intensity of the effect, basically how much the random values can offset the currently active light color. Defaults to `5%`.



*See also: [Addressable Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-flicker-effect)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: The name of the effect. Defaults to `Addressable Flicker`.



*See also: [Addressable Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-flicker-effect)*

addressable_flicker.markdownDescription:
An effect similar to the `flicker` effect, but for individually-addressable LED strips. This effect flickers each LED by its own random amount around the currently active light color.

*See also: [Addressable Flicker Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#addressable-flicker-effect)*

adalight.markdownDescription:
This effect enables controlling addressable lights using UART-based [Adalight](https://learn.adafruit.com/adalight-diy-ambient-tv-lighting) protocol, allowing to create realtime ambient lighting effects.

*See also: [Adalight Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#adalight-effect)*

universe.markdownDescription:
integer: The value of universe, between 1 to 512.



*See also: [E1.31 Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#e1-31-effect)*

channels.markdownDescription:
The type of data. This is used to specify if it is a `MONO`, `RGB` or `RGBW` light and in which order the colors are. Defaults to `RGB`.



*See also: [E1.31 Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#e1-31-effect)*

e131.markdownDescription:
This effect enables controlling addressable lights using UDP-based [E1.31](https://www.doityourselfchristmas.com/wiki/index.php?title=E1.31_(Streaming-ACN)_Protocol) protocol.

*See also: [E1.31 Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#e1-31-effect)*

port.markdownDescription:
integer: The port to run the UDP server on. Defaults to `21324`.



*See also: [WLED Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#wled-effect)*

wled.markdownDescription:
This effect enables controlling addressable lights using UDP-based [UDP Realtime Control](https://github.com/Aircoookie/WLED/wiki/UDP-Realtime-Control) protocol used by [WLED](https://github.com/Aircoookie/WLED/wiki/UDP-Realtime-Control), allowing to create realtime ambient lighting effects.

*See also: [WLED Effect](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#wled-effect)*

jvc.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded JVC remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The JVC code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

lg.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded LG remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The LG code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **nbits** (*Optional*, int): The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `28`.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

nec.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded NEC remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The NEC command to listen for.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

pioneer.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded Pioneer remote code with the given data.
  * **rc_code_1** (**Required**, int): The remote control code trigger on, see dumper output for more details.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

sony.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded Sony remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The Sony code to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **nbits** (*Optional*, int): The number of bits of the remote code. Defaults to `12`.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

raw.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a raw remote code with the given code.
  * **code** (**Required**, list): The code to listen for, see [remote_transmitter.transmit_raw Action](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-transmit-raw) for more info. Usually you only need to copy this directly from the dumper output.
