*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

rc5.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded RC5 remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The RC5 command to listen for.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

rc_switch_raw.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch raw remote code with the given data.
  * **code** (**Required**, string): The remote code to listen for, copy this from the dumper output. To ignore a bit in the received data, use `x` at that place in the **code**.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

rc_switch_type_a.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type A remote code with the given data.
  * **group** (**Required**, string): The group, binary string.
  
  * **device** (**Required**, string): The device in the group, binary string.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

rc_switch_type_b.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type B remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address, int from 1 to 4.
  
  * **channel** (**Required**, int): The channel, int from 1 to 4.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

rc_switch_type_c.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type C remote code with the given data.
  * **family** (**Required**, string): The family. Range is `a` to `p`.
  
  * **group** (**Required**, int): The group. Range is 1 to 4.
  
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The device. Range is 1 to 4.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

rc_switch_type_d.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded RC Switch Type D remote code with the given data.
  * **group** (**Required**, int): The group. Range is 1 to 4.
  
  * **device** (**Required**, int): The device. Range is 1 to 3.
  
  * **state** (**Required**, boolean): The on/off state to trigger on.
  
  * **protocol** (*Optional*): The RC Switch protocol to use, see [RC Switch Protocol](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#remote-transmitter-rc-switch-protocol) for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

samsung.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded Samsung remote code with the given data.
  * **data** (**Required**, int): The data to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

panasonic.markdownDescription:
Trigger on a decoded Panasonic remote code with the given data.
  * **address** (**Required**, int): The address to trigger on, see dumper output for more info.
  
  * **command** (**Required**, int): The command.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_receiver.html#id1)*

priority.markdownDescription:
float: The priority to execute your custom initialization code. A higher value means a high priority and thus also your code being executed earlier. Please note this is an ESPhome-internal value and any change will not be marked as a breaking change. Defaults to `-10`. Priorities (you can use any value between them too):
  * `800.0`: This is where all hardware initialization of vital components is executed. For example setting switches to their initial state.
  
  * `600.0`: This is where most sensors are set up.
  
  * `250.0`: At this priority, WiFi is initialized.
  
  * `200.0`: Network connections like MQTT/native API are set up at this priority.
  
  * `-100.0`: At this priority, pretty much everything should already be initialized.
  
  



*See also: [on_boot](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#on-boot)*

name.markdownDescription:
string: This is the name of the node. It should always be unique in your ESPhome network. May only contain lowercase characters, digits, underscores and hyphens. See [Changing ESPHome Node Name](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-changing-node-name).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

platform.markdownDescription:
string: The platform your board is on, either `ESP32` or `ESP8266`. See [arduino_version](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-arduino-version).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

board.markdownDescription:
string: The board ESPHome should specify for PlatformIO. For the ESP32, choose the appropriate one from [this list](http://docs.platformio.org/en/latest/platforms/espressif32.html#boards) and use [this list](http://docs.platformio.org/en/latest/platforms/espressif8266.html#boards) for ESP8266-based boards. *This only affects pin aliases and some internal settings*, if unsure choose the generic board option!



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

comment.markdownDescription:
string: Additional text information about this node. Only for display in UI.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

arduino_version.markdownDescription:
The version of the Arduino framework to link the project against. See [arduino_version](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-arduino-version).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

build_path.markdownDescription:
string: Customize where ESPHome will store the build files for your node. By default, ESPHome puts all PlatformIO project files under a folder `<NODE_NAME>/`, but you can customize this behavior using this option.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

platformio_options.markdownDescription:
mapping: Additional options to pass over to PlatformIO in the platformio.ini file. See [platformio_options](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-platformio-options).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

esp8266_restore_from_flash.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to save & restore data from flash on ESP8266s. Defaults to `no`. See [esp8266_restore_from_flash](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-esp8266-restore-from-flash) for more info



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

on_boot.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when the node starts. See [on_boot](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-on-boot).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

on_shutdown.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform right before the node shuts down. See [on_shutdown](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-on-shutdown).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

on_loop.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform on each `loop()` iteration. See [on_loop](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-on-loop).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

includes.markdownDescription:
list of files: A list of C[++] files to include in the main (auto-generated) sketch file for custom components. The paths in this list are relative to the directory where the YAML configuration file is in. Should have file extension `.h` - See [includes](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#esphome-includes) for more info.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

libraries.markdownDescription:
list of libraries: A list of [platformio libraries](https://platformio.org/lib) to include in the project. See [platformio lib install](https://docs.platformio.org/en/latest/userguide/lib/cmd_install.html).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#configuration-variables)*

min_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The minimum duration the click should last. Defaults to `50ms`.



*See also: [on_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-click)*

max_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The maximum duration the click should last. Defaults to `350ms`.



*See also: [on_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-click)*

min_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The minimum duration the click should last. Defaults to `50ms`.



*See also: [on_double_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-double-click)*

max_length.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The maximum duration the click should last. Defaults to `350ms`.



*See also: [on_double_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-double-click)*

timing.markdownDescription:
The timing of the multi click. This uses a language-based grammar using these styles:
  * `<ON/OFF> for <TIME> to <TIME>`
  
  * `<ON/OFF> for at least <TIME>`
  
  * `<ON/OFF> for at most <TIME>`
  
  



*See also: [on_multi_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-multi-click)*

invalid_cooldown.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): If a multi click is started, but the timing set in `timing` does not match, a “cool down” period will be activated during which no timing will be matched. Defaults to `1s`.



*See also: [on_multi_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#on-multi-click)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/status.html#configuration-variables)*

device_class.markdownDescription:
string: The device class for the sensor. See [https://www.home-assistant.io/components/binary_sensor/](https://www.home-assistant.io/components/binary_sensor/) for a list of available options.



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

filters.markdownDescription:
list: A list of filters to apply on the binary sensor values such as inverting signals. See [Binary Sensor Filters](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-filters).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_press.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when the button is pressed. See [on_press](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-press).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_release.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when the button is released. See [on_release](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-release).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_click.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when the button is held down for a specified period of time. See [on_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-click).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_double_click.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when the button is pressed twice for specified periods of time. See [on_double_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-double-click).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_multi_click.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when the button is pressed in a specific sequence. See [on_multi_click](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-multi-click).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

on_state.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when a state is published. See [on_state](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#binary-sensor-on-state).



*See also: [Base Binary Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/index.html#base-binary-sensor-configuration)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Base CAN Bus Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

can_id.markdownDescription:
integer: default *can id* used for transmitting frames.



*See also: [Base CAN Bus Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

bit_rate.markdownDescription:
enum: One of the supported bitrates. Defaults to `125KBPS`.
  * 5KBPS
  
  * 10KBPS
  
  * 20KBPS
  
  * 31K25BPS
  
  * 33KBPS
  
  * 40KBPS
  
  * 50KBPS
  
  * 80KBPS
  
  * 83K3BPS
  
  * 95KBPS
  
  * 100KBPS
  
  * 125KBPS
  
  * 200KBPS
  
  * 250KBPS
  
  * 500KBPS
  
  * 1000KBPS
  
  



*See also: [Base CAN Bus Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

use_extended_id.markdownDescription:
boolean: default *False* identifies the type of *can_id*: *False*: Standard 11 bits IDs, *True*: Extended 29 bits ID



*See also: [Base CAN Bus Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

on_frame.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when ability CAN Frame is received. See [on_frame](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#canbus-on-frame).



*See also: [Base CAN Bus Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#base-can-bus-configuration)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID of the climate device to control.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

mode.markdownDescription:
string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Put the climate device in a specific mode. One of `OFF`, `AUTO`, `COOL` and `HEAT`.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

target_temperature.markdownDescription:
float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Set the target temperature of a climate device.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

target_temperature_low.markdownDescription:
float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Set the lower target temperature of a climate device with a two-point target temperature.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

target_temperature_high.markdownDescription:
float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Set the higher target temperature of a climate device with a two-point target temperature.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

away.markdownDescription:
boolean, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Set the away mode of the climate device.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

fan_mode.markdownDescription:
boolean, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Set the fan mode of the climate device. One of `ON`, `OFF`, `AUTO`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH`, `MIDDLE`, `FOCUS`, `DIFFUSE`.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

swing_mode.markdownDescription:
boolean, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable): Set the swing mode of the climate device. One of `OFF`, `BOTH`, `VERTICAL`, `HORIZONTAL`.



*See also: [climate.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#climate-control-action)*

visual.markdownDescription:
Visual settings for the climate device - these do not affect operation and are solely for controlling how the climate device shows up in the frontend.
  * **min_temperature** (*Optional*, float): The minimum temperature the climate device can reach. Used to set the range of the frontend gauge.
  
  * **max_temperature** (*Optional*, float): The maximum temperature the climate device can reach. Used to set the range of the frontend gauge.
  
  * **temperature_step** (*Optional*, float): The granularity with which the target temperature can be controlled.
  
  



*See also: [Base Climate Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/climate/index.html#base-climate-configuration)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The cover to control.



*See also: [cover.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

stop.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to stop the cover.



*See also: [cover.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

state.markdownDescription:
string: The state to set the cover to - one of `OPEN` or `CLOSE`.



*See also: [cover.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

position.markdownDescription:
float: The cover position to set.
  * `0.0` = `0%` = `CLOSED`
  
  * `1.0` = `100%` = `OPEN`
  
  



*See also: [cover.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

tilt.markdownDescription:
float: The tilt position to set. In range 0% - 100%.



*See also: [cover.control Action](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-control-action)*

device_class.markdownDescription:
string: The device class for the sensor. See [https://www.home-assistant.io/components/cover/](https://www.home-assistant.io/components/cover/) for a list of available options.



*See also: [Base Cover Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#base-cover-configuration)*

oscillation_state_topic.markdownDescription:
string: The topic to publish fan oscillation state changes to.



*See also: [Base Fan Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

oscillation_command_topic.markdownDescription:
string: The topic to receive oscillation commands on.



*See also: [Base Fan Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

speed_state_topic.markdownDescription:
string: The topic to publish fan speed state changes to.



*See also: [Base Fan Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

speed_command_topic.markdownDescription:
string: The topic to receive speed commands on.



*See also: [Base Fan Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/fan/index.html#base-fan-configuration)*

restore_mode.markdownDescription:
Control how the GPIO Switch attempts to restore state on bootup. For restoring on ESP8266s, also see `esp8266_restore_from_flash` in the [esphome section](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html).
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_OFF` (Default) - Attempt to restore state and default to OFF if not possible to restore.
  
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON` - Attempt to restore state and default to ON.
  
  * `ALWAYS_OFF` - Always initialize the light as OFF on bootup.
  
  * `ALWAYS_ON` - Always initialize the light as ON on bootup.
  
  



*See also: [Base Light Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#base-light-configuration)*

on_turn_on.markdownDescription:
[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): An automation to perform when the light is turned on. See [light.on_turn_on / light.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-on-turn-on-off-trigger).



*See also: [Base Light Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#base-light-configuration)*

on_turn_off.markdownDescription:
[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): An automation to perform when the light is turned off. See [light.on_turn_on / light.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#light-on-turn-on-off-trigger).



*See also: [Base Light Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/light/index.html#base-light-configuration)*

max_power.markdownDescription:
float: Sets the maximum output value of this output platform. Must be in range from min_power to 1. Defaults to `1`.



*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

min_power.markdownDescription:
float: Sets the minimum output value of this output platform. Must be in range from 0 to max_power. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

output.FLOAT_OUTPUT_SCHEMA.markdownDescription:
Each output platform extends this configuration schema.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

above.markdownDescription:
float: The minimum for the trigger.



*See also: [on_value_range](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#on-value-range)*

below.markdownDescription:
float: The maximum for the trigger.



*See also: [on_value_range](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#on-value-range)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/wifi_signal.html#configuration-variables)*

unit_of_measurement.markdownDescription:
string: Manually set the unit of measurement the sensor should advertise its values with. This does not actually do any maths (conversion between units).



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

icon.markdownDescription:
icon: Manually set the icon to use for the sensor in the frontend. The icon set here is ignored by Home Assistant, if a device class is already set.



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

accuracy_decimals.markdownDescription:
int: Manually set the accuracy of decimals to use when reporting values.



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

device_class.markdownDescription:
string: The device class for the sensor. See [https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sensor/#device-class](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sensor/#device-class) for a list of available options. Set to `""` to remove the default device class of a sensor.



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

force_update.markdownDescription:
boolean: If true, this option will force the frontend (usually Home Assistant) to create a state changed event when the sensor updates even if the value stayed the same. Some applications like Grafana require this when working with Home Assistant, but beware it can significantly increase the database size. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

expire_after.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): Manually set the time in which the sensor values should be marked as “expired”/“unknown”. Not providing any value means no expiry.



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

filters.markdownDescription:
Specify filters to use for some basic transforming of values. See [Sensor Filters](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-filters) for more information.



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

on_value.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when a new value is published. See [on_value](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-on-value).



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

on_raw_value.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when a raw value is received that hasn’t passed through any filters. See [on_raw_value](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-on-raw-value).



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

on_value_range.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when a published value transition from outside to a range to inside. See [on_value_range](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#sensor-on-value-range).



*See also: [Base Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/index.html#base-sensor-configuration)*

max_speed.markdownDescription:
float: The maximum speed in `steps/s` (steps per seconds) to drive the stepper at. Note most steppers can’t step properly with speeds higher than 250 steps/s.



*See also: [Base Stepper Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#base-stepper-configuration)*

acceleration.markdownDescription:
float: The acceleration in `steps/s^2` (steps per seconds squared) to use when starting to move. The default is `inf` which means infinite acceleration, so the stepper will try to drive with the full speed immediately. This value is helpful if that first motion of the motor is too jerky for what it’s moving.  If you make this a small number, it will take the motor a moment to get up  to speed.



*See also: [Base Stepper Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#base-stepper-configuration)*

deceleration.markdownDescription:
float: The same as `acceleration`, but for when the motor is decelerating shortly before reaching the set position. Defaults to `inf` (immediate deceleration).



*See also: [Base Stepper Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/stepper/index.html#base-stepper-configuration)*

icon.markdownDescription:
icon: Manually set the icon to use for the sensor in the frontend.



*See also: [Base Switch Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

inverted.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to invert the binary state, i.e. report ON states as OFF and vice versa. Defaults to `False`.



*See also: [Base Switch Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

on_turn_on.markdownDescription:
[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): An automation to perform when the switch is turned on. See [switch.on_turn_on / switch.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-on-turn-on-off-trigger).



*See also: [Base Switch Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

on_turn_off.markdownDescription:
[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action): An automation to perform when the switch is turned off. See [switch.on_turn_on / switch.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-on-turn-on-off-trigger).



*See also: [Base Switch Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

icon.markdownDescription:
icon: Manually set the icon to use for the sensor in the frontend.



*See also: [Base Text Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/index.html#base-text-sensor-configuration)*

on_value.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An automation to perform when a new value is published. See [on_value](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/index.html#text-sensor-on-value).



*See also: [Base Text Sensor Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/index.html#base-text-sensor-configuration)*

seconds.markdownDescription:
string: Specify for which seconds of the minute the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all seconds). Range is from 0 to 59.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

minutes.markdownDescription:
string: Specify for which minutes of the hour the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all minutes). Range is from 0 to 59.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

hours.markdownDescription:
string: Specify for which hours of the day the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all hours). Range is from 0 to 23.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

days_of_month.markdownDescription:
string: Specify for which days of the month the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all days). Range is from 1 to 31.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

months.markdownDescription:
string: Specify for which months of the year to trigger. Defaults to `*` (all months). The month names JAN to DEC are automatically substituted. Range is from 1 (January) to 12 (December).



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

days_of_week.markdownDescription:
string: Specify for which days of the week to trigger. Defaults to `*` (all days). The names SUN to SAT are automatically substituted. Range is from 1 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturday).



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

cron.markdownDescription:
string: Alternatively, you can specify a whole cron expression like `* /5 * * * *`. Please note years and some special characters like `L`, `#` are currently not supported.



*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#on-time-trigger)*

timezone.markdownDescription:
string: Manually tell ESPHome what time zone to use with [this format](https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/TZ-Variable.html) (warning: the format is quite complicated) or the simpler [TZ database name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) in the form <Region>/<City>. ESPHome tries to automatically infer the time zone string based on the time zone of the computer that is running ESPHome, but this might not always be accurate.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

on_time.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): Automation to run at specific intervals using a cron-like syntax. See [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#time-on-time).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

on_time_sync.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): Automation to run when the time source could be (re-)synchronized.. See [on_time_sync Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#time-on-time-sync).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/time.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID for this ADS1115 Hub. Use this if you want to use multiple ADS1115 hubs at once.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#configuration-variables)*

continuous_mode.markdownDescription:
boolean: Set if the ADS1115 should continuously measure voltages or only measure them when an update is called. Please enable this for the [CT Clamp Current Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ct_clamp.html) integration. Defaults to `off`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ads1115.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID with which you will be able to reference the animation later in your display code.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

file.markdownDescription:
string: The path (relative to where the .yaml file is) of the gif file.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

resize.markdownDescription:
string: If set, this will resize all the frames to fit inside the given dimensions `WIDTHxHEIGHT` and preserve the aspect ratio.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

type.markdownDescription:
Specifies how to encode each frame internally. Defaults to `BINARY`.
  * `BINARY`: Two colors, suitable for 1 color displays or 2 color image in color displays. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte.
  
  * `GREYSCALE`: Full scale grey. Uses 8 bits per pixel, 1 pixel per byte.
  
  * `RGB24`: Full RGB color stored. Uses 3 bytes per pixel.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#configuration-variables)*

red.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage of the red component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

green.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage of the green component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

blue.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage of the blue component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

white.markdownDescription:
percentage: The percentage of the white component. Defaults to `100%`.



*See also: [Color](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#color)*

lambda.markdownDescription:
[lambda](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda): The lambda to run for instantiating the binary sensor(s).



*See also: [Generic Custom Component](https://esphome.io/custom/custom_component.html#generic-custom-component)*

components.markdownDescription:
list: A list of components to initialize. The length here must equal the number of items in the `return` statement of the `lambda`. This is useful if you need to give an `id` to the component you created.



*See also: [Generic Custom Component](https://esphome.io/custom/custom_component.html#generic-custom-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/dallas.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.markdownDescription:
number: The pin the sensor bus is connected to.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/dallas.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID used for code generation.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#configuration-variables)*

on_finished_playback.markdownDescription:
[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation): An action to be performed when playback is finished.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/dfplayer.html#configuration-variables)*

mac_address.markdownDescription:
MAC Address: The MAC address to filter for this automation.



*See also: [on_ble_advertise](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-advertise)*

MAC Address: The MAC address to filter for this automation.



*See also: [on_ble_service_data_advertise](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-service-data-advertise)*

service_uuid.markdownDescription:
string: 16 bit, 32 bit, or 128 bit BLE Service UUID.



*See also: [on_ble_service_data_advertise](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-service-data-advertise)*

mac_address.markdownDescription:
MAC Address: The MAC address to filter for this automation.



*See also: [on_ble_manufacturer_data_advertise](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-manufacturer-data-advertise)*

manufacturer_id.markdownDescription:
string: 16 bit, 32 bit, or 128 bit BLE Manufacturer ID.



*See also: [on_ble_manufacturer_data_advertise](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html#on-ble-manufacturer-data-advertise)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID with which you will be able to reference the font later in your display code.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

file.markdownDescription:
string: The path (relative to where the .yaml file is) of the TrueType font file.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

glyphs.markdownDescription:
list: A list of characters you plan to use. Only the characters you specify here will be compiled into the binary. Adjust this if you need some special characters or want to reduce the size of the binary if you don’t plan to use some glyphs. The items in the list can also be more than one character long if you for example want to use font ligatures. Defaults to `!"%()+,-_.:°0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz`.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

size.markdownDescription:
int: The size of the font in pt (not pixel!). If you want to use the same font in different sizes, create two font objects. Defaults to `20`.



*See also: [Drawing Static Text](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#drawing-static-text)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Give the global variable an ID so that you can refer to it later in [lambdas](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda).



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

type.markdownDescription:
string: The C++ type of the global variable, for example `bool` (for `true`/`false`), `int` (for integers), `float` (for decimal numbers), `int[50]` for an array of 50 integers, etc.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

initial_value.markdownDescription:
string: The value with which to initialize this variable if the state can not be restored or if state restoration is not enabled. This needs to be wrapped in quotes! Defaults to the C++ default value for this type (for example `0` for integers).



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

restore_value.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to try to restore the state on boot up. Be careful: on the ESP8266, you only have a total of 96 bytes available for this! Defaults to `no`. This will use storage in “RTC memory”, so it won’t survive a power-cycle unless you use the `esp8266_restore_from_flash` option to save to flash. See [esp8266_restore_from_flash](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html) for details.



*See also: [Global Variables](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#global-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID for this I²C bus if you need multiple I²C buses.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

sda.markdownDescription:
[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin): The pin for the data line of the I²C bus. Defaults to the default of your board (usually GPIO21 for ESP32 and GPIO4 for ESP8266).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

scl.markdownDescription:
[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin): The pin for the clock line of the I²C bus. Defaults to the default of your board (usually GPIO22 for ESP32 and GPIO5 for ESP8266).



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

frequency.markdownDescription:
float: Set the frequency the I²C bus should operate on. Defaults to `50kHz`. Values are `50kHz`, `100kHz`, `200kHz`, … `800kHz`



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

scan.markdownDescription:
boolean: If ESPHome should do a search of the I²C address space on startup. Defaults to `True`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The ID with which you will be able to reference the image later in your display code.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

file.markdownDescription:
string: The path (relative to where the .yaml file is) of the image file.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

resize.markdownDescription:
string: If set, this will resize the image to fit inside the given dimensions `WIDTHxHEIGHT` and preserve the aspect ratio.



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

type.markdownDescription:
Specifies how to encode image internally. Defaults to `BINARY`.
  * `BINARY`: Two colors, suitable for 1 color displays or 2 color image in color displays. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte.
  
  * `GREYSCALE`: Full scale grey. Uses 8 bits per pixel, 1 pixel per byte.
  
  * `RGB24`: Full RGB color stored. Uses 3 bytes per pixel.
  
  



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

dither.markdownDescription:
Specifies which dither method used to process the image, only used in GREYSCALE and BINARY type image. Defaults to `NONE`. You can read more about it [here](https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/Image.html?highlight=Dither#PIL.Image.Image.convert) and [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dither).
  * `NONE`: Every pixel convert to its nearest color.
  
  * `FLOYDSTEINBERG`: Uses Floyd-Steinberg dither to approximate the original image luminosity levels.
  
  



*See also: [Images](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#images)*

interval.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The interval to execute the action with.



*See also: [interval Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#interval-component)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this MCP23008 component.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp230xx.html#configuration-variables)*

open_drain_interrupt.markdownDescription:
bool: Configure the interrupt pin to open-drain mode. Useful when the MCP23008’s power supply is greater than 3.3 volts. Note that this pin will require a pull-up resistor (to 3.3 volts) when this mode is enabled.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp230xx.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this MCP23016 component.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp230xx.html#id1)*

[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this MCP23017 component.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp230xx.html#id2)*

open_drain_interrupt.markdownDescription:
bool: Configure interrupt pins to open-drain mode. Useful when the MCP23017’s power supply is greater than 3.3 volts. Note that these pins will require pull-up resistors (to 3.3 volts) when this mode is enabled.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp230xx.html#id2)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this MCP23S08 component.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp23Sxx.html#configuration-variables)*

deviceaddress.markdownDescription:
int: The address of the chip. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp23Sxx.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this MCP23S17 component.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp23Sxx.html#id1)*

deviceaddress.markdownDescription:
int: The address of the chip. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/mcp23Sxx.html#id1)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this MCP3008 component.



*See also: [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/mcp3008.html#component-hub)*

[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Set the ID of this sensor.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/mpr121.html#configuration-variables)*

release_debounce.markdownDescription:
integer: The minimum length that no touch is recognized before a release event is created. Range is from 0 to 7. Defaults to 0.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/mpr121.html#configuration-variables)*

touch_debounce.markdownDescription:
integer: The minimum length before a touch is recognized. Range is from 0 to 7. Defaults to 0.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/mpr121.html#configuration-variables)*

touch_threshold.markdownDescription:
integer: The touch threshold for all channels. This defines the sensitivity for touch detection and should be between 5 and 30 (lower = more sensitive). Defaults to 12. Typically the touch threshold is a little bigger than the release threshold.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/mpr121.html#configuration-variables)*

release_threshold.markdownDescription:
integer: The release defines the sensitivity for touch detection and should be between 5 and 30. Defaults to 6.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/mpr121.html#configuration-variables)*

topic.markdownDescription:
string: The MQTT topic to subscribe to and listen for MQTT messages on. Every time a message with **this exact topic** is received, the automation will trigger.



*See also: [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-message-trigger)*

qos.markdownDescription:
integer: The MQTT Quality of Service to subscribe to the topic with. Defaults to 0.



*See also: [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-message-trigger)*

payload.markdownDescription:
string: Optionally set a payload to match. Only if exactly the payload you specify with this option is received, the automation will be executed.



*See also: [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-message-trigger)*

topic.markdownDescription:
string: The MQTT topic to subscribe to and listen for MQTT messages on. Every time a message with **this exact topic** is received, the automation will trigger.



*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-json-message-trigger)*

qos.markdownDescription:
integer: The MQTT Quality of Service to subscribe to the topic with. Defaults to 0.



*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-json-message-trigger)*

id.markdownDescription:
[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): The id to use for this `my9231` component. Use this if you have multiple MY9231/MY9291 chains connected at the same time.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#configuration-variables)*

data_pin.markdownDescription:
[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema): The pin which DI is connected to.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#configuration-variables)*

clock_pin.markdownDescription:
[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema): The pin which DCKI is connected to.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#configuration-variables)*

num_channels.markdownDescription:
int: Total number of channels of the whole chain. Must be in range from 3 to 1020. Defaults to 6.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#configuration-variables)*

num_chips.markdownDescription:
int: Number of chips in the chain. Must be in range from 1 to 255. Defaults to 2.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#configuration-variables)*

bit_depth.markdownDescription:
int: The bit depth to use for all output channels in this chain. Must be one of 8, 12, 14 or 16. Defaults to 16.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#configuration-variables)*

dump.markdownDescription:
list: Decode and dump these remote codes in the logs (at log.level=DEBUG). Set to `all` to dump all available codecs:

  * **pioneer**: Decode and dump Pioneer infrared codes.
  
  * **jvc**: Decode and dump JVC infrared codes.
  
  * **samsung**: Decode and dump Samsung infrared codes.
  
  * **sony**: Decode and dump Sony infrared codes.

tolerance.markdownDescription:

idle.markdownDescription:

*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter.html#configuration-variables)*

mode.markdownDescription:
string: Controls what happens when a script is invoked while it is still running from one or more previous invocations. Default to `single`.
  * `single`: Do not start a new run. Issue a warning.
  
  * `restart`: Start a new run after first stopping previous run.
  
  * `queued`: Start a new run after previous runs complete.
  
  * `parallel`: Start a new, independent run in parallel with previous runs.
  
  



*See also: [script Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-component)*

max_runs.markdownDescription:
integer: Allows limiting the maxiumun number of runs when using script modes `queued` and `parallel`, use value `0` for unlimited runs. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [script Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-component)*

idle_level.markdownDescription:
percentage: The PWM duty cycle the idle value (0%) will map to. This is also the state of the servo at startup. Defaults to `7.5%`.

max_level.markdownDescription:
percentage: The PWM duty cycle the maximum value (100%) will map to. Defaults to `12.0%`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

restore.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether to restore the state of the servo motor at startup. This is useful if you have an absolute servo motor and it goes back to its 0 position at startup. Defaults to `false`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

auto_detach_time.markdownDescription:
[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time): The time after reaching the target value when the servo will be detached`, if set to zero, servo will not be detached. Defaults to `0s`.

transition_length.markdownDescription:

This will effectively limit the speed of the servo, the larger the value, the slowest the servo will move. Defaults to `` 0s`` This can slow down the servo to avoid loud noises or just make the movement not jerking.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/servo.html#configuration-variables)*

clock_pin.markdownDescription:

oe_pin.markdownDescription:

sr_count.markdownDescription:
int: Number of daisy-chained shift registers, up-to 4. Defaults to `1`.

clk_pin.markdownDescription:

miso_pin.markdownDescription:

mosi_pin.markdownDescription:

id.markdownDescription:

keypad.markdownDescription:
Add this to enable the keypad.
  * **key_rows** (**Required**, int): The number of keypad rows to use. This enables any number of the first 7 pins. So a value of 3 enables pins 0,1,2 to be used as the rows for the keypad matrix. This value must be between 1 and 8.
  
  * **key_columns** (**Required**, int): The number of keypad columns to use. This enables any number of the last 7 pins. So a value of 4 enables pins 8,9,10,11 to be used as the columns for the keypad matrix. This value must be between 1 and 8.
  
  * **sleep_time** (*Optional*, int): No key press within this time will set keypad engine to sleep.
  
  * **scan_time** (*Optional*, int): Scan time per row (must be set above debounce time).
  
  * **debounce_time** (*Optional*, int): The debounce time is common to all IOs.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/sx1509.html#configuration-variables)*

id.markdownDescription:

[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id): Manually specify the ID for this UART hub if you need multiple UART hubs.

int: The baud rate of the UART bus.

int: The size of the buffer used for receiving UART messages. Increase if you use integration that needs to read big payloads from UART. Defaults to `256`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

stop_bits.markdownDescription:
int: The number of stop bits to send. Options: 1, 2. Defaults to 1.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

data_bits.markdownDescription:
int: The number of data bits used on the UART bus. Options: 5 to 8. Defaults to 8.

parity.markdownDescription:
The parity used on the UART bus. Options: `NONE`, `EVEN`, `ODD`. Defaults to `NONE`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#configuration-variables)*

ssid.markdownDescription:
string: The SSID or WiFi network name.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

password.markdownDescription:
string: The password to use for authentication. Leave empty for no password.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

channel.markdownDescription:
int: The channel of the network (1-14). If given, only connects to networks that are on this channel.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

bssid.markdownDescription:
string: Optionally define a BSSID (MAC-Address) of the network to connect to. This can be used to further restrict which networks to connect to.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

hidden.markdownDescription:
boolean: Whether this network is hidden. Defaults to false. If you add this option you also have to specify ssid.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

priority.markdownDescription:
float: The priority of this network. After each time, the network with the highest priority is chosen. If the connection fails, the priority is decreased by one. Defaults to `0`.



*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

identity.markdownDescription:

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `pn532` component allows you to use PN532 NFC/RFID controllers ([datasheet](https://cdn-shop.adafruit.com/datasheets/pn532ds.pdf), [Adafruit](https://www.adafruit.com/product/364)) with ESPHome. This component is a global hub that establishes the connection to the PN532 via [SPI](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi) or [I²C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) and outputs its data. Using the [PN532 binary sensors](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/pn532.html#pn532-tag) you can then create individual binary sensors that track if an NFC/RFID tag is currently detected by the PN532.

*See also: [PN532 NFC/RFID](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/pn532.html#pn532-nfc-rfid)*

id.markdownDescription:

uid.markdownDescription:
string: The unique ID of the RFID tag. This is a hyphen-separated list of hexadecimal values. For example `74-10-37-94`.



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#id2)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `rc522` component allows you to use RC522 RFID controllers ([datasheet](hthttps://www.nxp.com/docs/en/data-sheet/MFRC522.pdff), [Ali Express](https://es.aliexpress.com/item/1260729519.html)) with ESPHome. ESPHome can read the tag UID from it, every RFID tag comes with a unique UID value. Each known tag can be associated to a binary sensor, or you can use the tag information directly. See [Setting Up Tags](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#rc522-setting-up-tags) for information on how to setup individual binary sensors for this component. The RC522 supports SPI, I²C and UART communication protocols, ESPHome can use either SPI or I²C.

*See also: [RC522 RFID](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#rc522-rfid)*

This component is a global hub that establishes the connection to the RDM6300 via [UART](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html#uart) and translates the received data. Using the [RDM6300 binary sensors](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rdm6300.html#rdm6300-tag) you can then create individual binary sensors that track if an NFC/RFID tag is currently detected by the RDM6300.

*See also: [RDM6300 NFC/RFID](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rdm6300.html#rdm6300-nfc-rfid)*

canbus.markdownDescription:
Controller Area Network (CAN bus) is a serial bus protocol to connect individual systems and sensors as an alternative to conventional multi-wire looms. It allows automotive components to communicate on a single or dual-wire networked data bus up to 1Mbps. CAN is an International Standardization Organization (ISO) defined serial communications bus originally developed for the automotive industry to replace the complex wiring harness with a two-wire bus. The specification calls for high immunity to electrical interference and the ability to self-diagnose and repair data errors. These features have led to CAN’s popularity in a variety of industries including building automation, medical, and manufacturing.

*See also: [CAN bus](https://esphome.io/components/canbus.html#can-bus)*

control_parameters.markdownDescription:
Control parameters of the PID controller.
  * **kp** (**Required**, float): The factor for the proportional term of the PID controller.
  
  * **ki** (*Optional*, float): The factor for the integral term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.
  
  * **kd** (*Optional*, float): The factor for the derivative term of the PID controller. Defaults to `0`.
  
  * **min_integral** (*Optional*, float): The maximum value of the integral term multiplied by `ki` to prevent windup. Defaults to `-1`.
  
  * **max_integral** (*Optional*, float): The minimum value of the integral term multiplied by `ki` to prevent windup. Defaults to `1`.
  
  



*See also: [Configuration variables:](https://esphome.io/components/climate/pid.html#configuration-variables)*

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `thermostat` climate platform allows you to control a climate control system in much the same manner as a physical thermostat. Its operation is similar to the [bang-bang](https://esphome.io/components/climate/bang_bang.html) controller; a sensor measures a value (the air temperature) and the controller will try to keep this value within a range defined by the set point(s). To do this, the controller can activate devices like a heating unit and/or a cooling unit to change the value observed by the sensor. When configured for both heating and cooling, it is essentially two [bang-bang](https://esphome.io/components/climate/bang_bang.html) controllers in one; it differs, however, in that interation with the thermostat component is nearly identical to that of a real thermostat.

*See also: [Thermostat Climate Controller](https://esphome.io/components/climate/thermostat.html#thermostat-climate-controller)*

Defaults to `False`.

allOf.markdownDescription:
The `time_based` cover platform allows you to create covers with position control that do not have any position feedback. The state of the cover is thus always an assumed one, the current position is approximated with the time the cover has been moving in a direction.

*See also: [Time-Based Cover](https://esphome.io/components/cover/time_based.html#time-based-cover)*

cover.markdownDescription:
The `cover` component is a generic representation of covers in ESPHome. A cover can (currently) either be *closed* or *open* and supports three types of commands: *open*, *close* and *stop*.

*See also: [Cover Component](https://esphome.io/components/cover/index.html#cover-component)*

allOf.markdownDescription:

  * `CONTINUOUS`: Always scrolls and the text repeats continuously, you might need to add some separation at the end.
  
  * `STOP`: When text is over it waits the `scroll_dwell` time and scroll is set back to the start.
